resources.string: Saving processed image to the card

This application demonstrates the gravitational effect of an small black hole nearby you. It uses a back camera of your mobile phone, to see the environment, and then it deflects the light rays according to the black hole gravitational pull. The whole effect is called the gravitational lens, and can be understood by looking at the picture(1) below - black hole as an red object in the center:

You can change the black hole mass by touching the screen with two fingers and then pinching or spreading them. Or, you can use the bottom-right black button to do the same - as you can see then, the black hole mass is of the order of inner planet mass - like mars or almost the earth. By clicking the big camera button in the middle, you can save the full-resolution image with the black hole on your phone storage card into the separate MyBlackHoles folder (use the menu option in the app to find the folder easier). The gravity lens here tries to be as accurate, as possible - yet it still assumes that all that the camera sees is very far away - which does not have to be neccessarily true - especially for the object close to you. Also, the approximation is not very accurate close to the event horizon (black circle in the middle - corresponding to the real size of the event horizon) - because the phone camera has only some narrow, limited field of view - so the artifacts close to the event horizon are unavoidable here. Black hole in this app is assumed to be always 1m away from you - the effect of increasing this distance would have exaclty the same effect as decreasing black hole mass. Non-rotating black hole is being used - something known as the Schwarzschild solution of the field equations for spherically-symetrical object. 
 Field of view of your back camera, as reported by the phone:
 horizontal: XXXXX degrees
 vertical : YYYYY degrees. 
 
 (1) Credit for the Andrew Hamilton for the picture.
Thank you for using this app.\n\n If you would like to support the me, you can always donate :)

Dziękuję za skorzystanie z tej applikacji. Jest ona całkowicie darmowa i bez reklam - pełna i płatna jej wersja na Google Play store ma identyczną funkcjonalność i jest jedynie sposobem na wsparcie finansowe.\n\n Jeśli chciałbyś mnie wspomóc w dalszym rozwijaniu tej aplikacji, usuwaniu błędów, poprawy tłumaczenia, możesz zawsze udzielić wsparcia finansowego :)
